TopicTitle: did the mods have a humour failure?

Articles.Content: Cmon, seriously. My thread about expecting a sequel today was clearly a joke about people complaining... now locked? Take a time out guys.

It's update time.

To mods, that's like full moon to a werewolf.

I generally avoid posting heavily the forum until sanity is restored.

That is actually pretty ridiculous. It was obviously in jest. Anyone with an ounce of humor could see that. I guess they are just a bit trigger happy with all of the critisism surrounding version 1. I don't blame them too much.
I don't really see this thread going anywhere good either.
isn't it a requirment for mods to not have a sense of homour,? I thought that was a general rule by the modders union

> 
> That is actually pretty ridiculous. It was obviously in jest. Anyone with an ounce of humor could see that. I guess they are just a bit trigger happy with all of the critisism surrounding version 1. I don't blame them too much.

we should send pizza. Lotta grumpy forum people annoying them (and me).

- - - Updated - - -

> 
> isn't it a requirment for mods to not have a sense of homour,? I thought that was a general rule by the modders union

Nahhh, they are usually ok on this forum. Been a long night I guess ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

If your thread was a joke, which it did seem to be, it didn't belong in General. But since it appeared to be *only* a joke, it didn't belong anywhere else, either, and so it was closed rather than moved. Now please, go back to talking about the game itself.
